title: `spack mirror` : wrong dependency resolution
body:
The command : 

``` shell
$ spack mirror create -d /home/mculpo/production/spack-mirror -D espresso+mpi+scalapack%gcc@5.3.0^openblas+shared^openmpi+psm
==> Error: Multiple providers found for 'mpi': ['mvapich2@2.2b%gcc@5.3.0~debug~gforker~hydra~mrail~nemesis~nemesisib~nemesisibtcp~psm~remshell~slurm~sock=production', 'openmpi@1.10.2%gcc@5.3.0+psm~tm~verbs=production']

```

fails with an error on the current `develop`, while : 

``` shell
$ spack mirror create -d /home/mculpo/production/spack-mirror -D espresso+mpi+scalapack%gcc@5.3.0^openblas+shared^netlib-scalapack^openmpi+psm
==> Adding package fftw@3.3.4 to mirror
==> fftw@3.3.4 : already added
==> Adding package netlib-scalapack@2.0.2 to mirror
==> netlib-scalapack@2.0.2 : already added
==> Adding package openmpi@1.10.2 to mirror
==> openmpi@1.10.2 : already added
==> Adding package espresso@5.3.0 to mirror
==> espresso@5.3.0 : already added
==> Adding package libpciaccess@0.13.4 to mirror
==> libpciaccess@0.13.4 : already added
==> Adding package cmake@3.5.2 to mirror
==> cmake@3.5.2 : already added
==> Adding package openblas@0.2.17 to mirror
==> openblas@0.2.17 : already added
==> Adding package hwloc@1.11.2 to mirror
==> hwloc@1.11.2 : already added
==> Adding package openssl@1.0.2g to mirror
==> openssl@1.0.2g : already added
==> Adding package zlib@1.2.8 to mirror
==> zlib@1.2.8 : already added
==> Adding package libtool@2.4.6 to mirror
==> libtool@2.4.6 : already added
==> Adding package ncurses@6.0 to mirror
==> ncurses@6.0 : already added
==> Successfully updated mirror in /home/mculpo/production/spack-mirror
```

completes successfully. It seems a bug to me the fact that, if not mentioned explicitly in the command line, `netlib-scalapack` mpi is resolved to be something else than `openmpi`. Note that : 

``` shell
$ spack install espresso+mpi+scalapack%gcc@5.3.0^openblas+shared^openmpi+psm
```

**does not** present the same problem.
